content.description: A thin and cryptic crux starts off the ground, but it lets up around halfway up. This has great movement on excellent stone!
content.protection: 4 bolts and a two bolt anchor with Mussy hooks. New ASCA hardware was installed in 2021.
content.location: It is across the canyon from the snakehead on the north-facing wall that's on the west side of the canyon.

content.description: This is the mega-classic of the area! It has super fun face climbing with multiple cruxes that keep you working all the way to the top. In the guide, it is given 5.12b, but it is clear there has been some crucial breakages and changes to this route, but even with the changes, it's soooo good! This is a nice change from the usual 15 feet of hard climbing to 40 feet of easy.
content.location:
This is to the right of

Mudhoney

.

content.description:
This route is on the overhanging pinnacle just before

Spiderbaby

. It has strange bolting, but you can expect that from Mullin. It starts off bouldery and apparently lets up after 3rd bolt.
content.location:
This is two routes left of

Spiderbaby

.

content.description: Stickclip the second bolt (it's harder than it looks). Climb through interesting holds until your reach the crimpy and sequential crux in the steep orange streak. Send the crux or take the whip!
content.protection: A stickclip, quickdraws, and a two bolt anchor with coldshuts.
content.location: It is located on the north-facing wall directly across the canyon (west side) from the snake head.

content.description:
This is a bouldery route 20 feet left of

Spiderbaby

. It starts off with a V4 boulder problem for the first 2 bolts then eases up quite a bit for the last 3 bolts. It has great rock just like its neighbors

Mudhoney

and

Spiderbaby

. Bring a stick clip.
content.location:
It is between

Mudhoney

and

Spiderbaby

.

content.description: This is a cool line with thoughtful and continuous climbing despite its lack of height. Start in the lower, twin mail slot pocket, make a big move up to crimps (crux), and then balance up to the anchors. This is harder for shorter folks.
content.protection: 3 quickdraws and a two bolt anchor with rings to lower.
content.location: On the far right side of the north facing buttress across from the snake head, look for the new black bolts.
